skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, or applications. Generates creative, polished code that avoids generic AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill wh...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only instructional content and design guidelines. No executable code, file operations, or network requests present.

content.value_statement: Creates visually striking, production-ready web interfaces with bold aesthetic choices that avoid generic AI-generated design patterns.
actual_capabilities: Generates production-grade HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other frontend code
Creates distinctive visual designs with bold aesthetic directions
Implements advanced animations and micro-interactions using CSS and Motion libraries
Designs cohesive color schemes and typography systems using CSS variables
Builds asymmetric, grid-breaking layouts with creative spatial composition
Applies contextual visual effects like gradients, textures, shadows, and overlays
Ensures accessibility and performance constraints are met
Adapts complexity to match aesthetic vision (minimalist vs maximalist approaches)
limitations: Focuses on frontend implementation only, not backend or API integration
Requires clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints for best results
Design choices are generative and may need iteration based on user feedback
Does not provide design mockups or wireframes, only working code

use_cases.title: Landing Page Design
use_cases.description: Create a memorable landing page with bold typography, creative layouts, and engaging animations that convert visitors
use_cases.target_user: Startups and product teams needing distinctive web presence

use_cases.title: Component Library
use_cases.description: Build a cohesive set of UI components with a unique aesthetic direction for a design system
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers establishing brand identity in code

use_cases.title: Interactive Dashboard
use_cases.description: Design data visualization interfaces with creative spatial composition and thoughtful micro-interactions
use_cases.target_user: Product designers building internal tools or analytics platforms

use_cases.title: Marketing Website
use_cases.description: Craft editorial-style pages with dramatic visual effects, asymmetric layouts, and scroll-triggered animations
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams wanting to stand out from competitors

use_cases.title: Portfolio Site
use_cases.description: Create unforgettable personal or agency portfolios with experimental layouts and distinctive visual identity
use_cases.target_user: Designers and creative professionals showcasing their work

prompt_templates.title: Component Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component type] for [purpose]. The aesthetic should be [tone/style]. Target audience is [user type]. Technical requirements: [framework/constraints].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a specific UI component with clear design direction

prompt_templates.title: Full Page Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [page type] for [product/service]. It should feel [aesthetic direction] and emphasize [key feature]. Use [color preference] and make it unforgettable.
prompt_templates.scenario: When building complete pages with strong conceptual direction

prompt_templates.title: Redesign Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Redesign this [existing component/page] to be more [aesthetic goal]. Keep the functionality but make it distinctive and avoid [specific anti-patterns].
prompt_templates.scenario: When improving existing interfaces with fresh aesthetic choices

prompt_templates.title: Exploratory Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an experimental [interface type] that pushes boundaries. Surprise me with [specific aspect like typography/layout/motion]. Purpose: [use case].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want maximum creative freedom and bold experimentation

output_examples.input: Create a pricing page for a SaaS product. Make it brutally minimal but unforgettable.
output_examples.output: Production React code featuring stark black/white palette, massive display typography (custom serif), generous negative space, subtle hover animations, and one dramatic accent color for CTAs. Grid-breaking layout with asymmetric pricing cards.

output_examples.input: Build a hero section for a music festival. It should feel maximalist and chaotic but controlled.
output_examples.output: HTML/CSS with layered gradient meshes, overlapping text at multiple angles, grain texture overlay, vibrant neon color palette, staggered animation-delay reveals, custom cursor, and diagonal flow breaking traditional grid structure.

best_practices: Provide clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints for optimal results
Mention any brand colors, fonts, or existing design systems to integrate with
State framework preferences upfront (React, Vue, vanilla HTML/CSS/JS)
Request specific features like dark mode, accessibility requirements, or animation preferences
Give feedback on iterations to refine the aesthetic direction
Ask for variations if you want to explore multiple design directions
anti_patterns: Asking for 'modern clean design' without specific aesthetic direction (leads to generic results)
Requesting designs without context about purpose or audience
Expecting pixel-perfect recreation of reference images (skill generates original designs)
Asking for backend or API integration (frontend-only skill)
Requesting designs in tools like Figma or Sketch (outputs working code, not design files)
Using vague descriptors like 'professional' or 'nice' instead of concrete aesthetic terms

faq.question: What frameworks and technologies does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill can generate code for HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other modern frontend frameworks. Specify your preferred technology in your request for best results.

faq.question: How do I avoid generic AI-looking designs?
faq.answer: Provide specific aesthetic direction (e.g., 'art deco geometric', 'organic natural', 'brutalist raw') rather than generic terms. The skill is designed to avoid common patterns like purple gradients, Inter font, and cookie-cutter layouts.

faq.question: Can I get multiple design variations?
faq.answer: Yes, ask for variations or different aesthetic approaches. The skill is instructed to never converge on common choices and vary between themes, fonts, and styles.

faq.question: Does this include animations and interactions?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill implements animations and micro-interactions, prioritizing CSS-only solutions for HTML and Motion library for React. Expect staggered reveals, hover states, and scroll-triggered effects.

faq.question: Is the code production-ready?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates production-grade, functional code with attention to accessibility and performance constraints. However, you should still review and test for your specific requirements.

faq.question: How detailed should my request be?
faq.answer: More context is better. Include purpose, audience, technical constraints, and aesthetic direction. Even one strong aesthetic keyword (e.g., 'maximalist', 'editorial') significantly improves results.
